results.title: In Spain, Abortions Are Legal, but Many Doctors Refuse to Perform Them
results.abstract: Many physicians in the country call themselves “conscientious objectors” and deny the procedures, often forcing women to travel long distances for one.

multimedia.caption: “It’s one thing if you think abortion is right or wrong; each person will have their own criteria,” said Dr. María Jesús Barco, a gynecologist from Zaragoza who is an objector. “It’s another thing if I have to do it. That’s different.”
multimedia.copyright: Ana María Arévalo Gosen for The New York Times

results.title: From Hero of ‘Hotel Rwanda,’ to Dissident, to 25-Year Prison Sentence
results.abstract: The trial of Paul Rusesabagina, whose story was portrayed in the Oscar-nominated movie, was denounced by human rights advocates as a “show trial” intended to silence critics of Rwanda’s president.
des_facet: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
